title.narrative: WASH SERVICES

description.narrative: Improved availability of affordable and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) facilities and services in guinea worm endemic areas, schools and health facilities as well as underserved communities, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved, equitable and sustainable use of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) service and facilities Guinea Worm endemic areas, schools and health facilities as well as underserved communities.

participating-org.narrative: STATE MINISTRY OF SOCIAL DEVELOPMEN CULTURE YOUTH AND SPORT

sector.narrative: Management and Operations support at CO
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved availability of affordable and sustainable WASH facilities and services in guinea worm endemic areas, schools and healthfacilities as well as underserved communities

description.narrative: A total of 568,714 people have been reached with access to safe water supply during January 2014 to June 2016, which reduced the number of Guinea Worm cases from 113 in 2013 to zero as of June 2016. Gender-sensitive latrines were constructed for 58,700 students in 112 schools. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2015

title.narrative: Number of functioning WASCOMs
Number of Health facilities with functional WASH services

actual.value: 2014:3 completed in Yambio Hospital, Al-Shabah Children Hospital and Juba Teaching Hospital. Thus 15% of the target has been achieved to date

title.narrative: Number of schools with functional WASH systems

actual.value: 2014:51 (51%) schools were provided with functional WASH systems through construction of water points, sanitary facilities and hygiene promotion in Central Equatoria, Jonglei and Warrap states thus serving 15,200 schoolchildren.
